sections.title: BIS Certification- An Overview
sections.text: The BIS is an Indian national standard body established by the Bureau of Indian Standards Act of 2016. It was created to facilitate the establishment of product standardisation, marking, and quality certification, as well as incidental or related issues.

Having a BIS mark on your product or service assures that you are supplying secure and trustworthy items of high quality, lowering consumer health risks. It also encourages import and export alternatives, reducing variety proliferation. As a result, indirectly BIS initiates traceable and noticeable advantages to the national economy.
The main objective of the BIS is as follows:

sections.items: Growth of standardisation, quality certification, and marking that is continuous and harmonious | Seamless creation of a national strategy for standard recognition and synchronisation with the growth of exports and products | To guarantee a fresh approach to quality assurance and standardisation.

sections.title: What Is FMCS Registration?
sections.text: A foreign manufacturer is awarded a license under FMCS to use a standard mark on a product if it complies with an Indian Standard. The certification of the standards may be required or optional. For products produced in a manufacturing facility and meeting all applicable Indian standard requirements, a BIS license to use or apply the standard mark is awarded (s). The Foreign Manufacturers Certification Department (FMCD) at BIS Headquarters in New Delhi is responsible for issuing the license.

sections.title: How BIS Certification Can Help Your Business?
sections.text: BIS certification has a lot of advantages. Some of them are discussed below.

sections.heading: Legal Benefit
sections.text: This is the primary advantage of having a BIS certificate. It assures that the products manufactured by your firm are of top quality. From a legal perspective, the BIS certificate assures the higher quality of the product and adheres to the rules and regulations laid by the government. This turns out to be a unique Identity.

sections.heading: Competitive Advantage
sections.text: Having a BIS certificate provides greater leverage over your business competitors. A certified product tends to preserve credibility and the rest of the customers in the longer run. However uncertified products may face some legal issues and litigation. Most consumers tend to use certified products.

sections.heading: Showcase your Quality Standards
sections.text: As previously mentioned BIS certification implies that your products are of higher quality and comprise the terms and conditions of the government. BIS certification is not given easily to any product. The product has to undergo examination and multiple tests under the authorities. Only after providing proper reports, the laboratory will certify that the product is up to mark and avails BIS certification.

sections.heading: Greater Access to Global Markets
sections.text: Having your product certified through the BIS opens multiple doors on the global front. This provides greater opportunities for existing companies to gain access both in India and abroad. Manufacturers generate greater trust from the consumer and generate better revenue.

items.question: How many years is the BIS certificate valid?
items.answer: The certificates remain in effect for two years. BIS has the right to demand periodic product audits during these two years.

items.question: After certification, how do I have to mark my products?
items.answer: Products must bear the ISI logo (for BIS, ISI) or the BIS,CRS logo, depending on the certification.

items.question: How long does it take to be BIS certified?
items.answer: The process typically takes 2-3 months (without audit for BIS-CRS registration) or 4-6 months, depending on if an audit is necessary for your product certification (with an audit for BIS-ISI certification).

items.question: Which facilities require an audit?
items.answer: The product's production facility is where the audit for the BIS certification (ISI) always takes place. If production occurs at multiple sites, an audit must be performed at the facility where the final output of the quality-assuring production process occurs.
